document_data.mainbody:
uthness was a gallery owner of expensive artwork in Innarlith on the Lake of Steam in the mid–14 century DR.
He was in possession of very expensive sculptures.
In the , he sold a Kozakuran sculpture called "Small Evil Deity Crouches in the Running Stream, Mindful of Its Breathing" to Willem Korvan, who was trying to get it to impress Phyrea, the daughter of Inthelph, his patron. Luthness sold the sculpture for 45,000 gold pieces. The sculpture had been crafted by Akira Tanaka.
Marek Rymüt, a clandestine Red Wizard in Innarlith, was also a customer at his store.
